page.title: 17BIOGRAPHY:JOSEPH THOMSON
page.content: Joseph Thomson:explorer was born in 1858 in Penpont.Educated in the local school and at Edinburgh University he won prizes for geology,botany and chemistry. As a member of the Royal Geographical Society East Africa Expedition between 1878 and 1880 he was responsible for finding a practical route to the interior which would connect the great chain of central lakes to the east coast. His greatest journey of exploration was his expedition to Masai land in Equatorial East Africa. This was the last large expanse of the continent still unmapped.His success in explor- ation led to fame at the cost of sha- ttered health and impaired vitality. He died in 1895 and was brought from Africa for local burial. Thomson's Gazelle & Falls bear his name.
